data.title: I am looking for records on the Samoan Crisis that lasted from 1887 to 1889
data.meta_description: I am looking for records on the Samoan Crisis that lasted from 1887 to 1889, specifically military and presidential meeting minutes and correspondence about the
data.text:
joyewoods

To start your research we would recommend the “Subject File of the U.S. Navy”. These records are among the most utilized and accessible of the old naval records within our facility. The records are arranged by subject according to an alphabetical classification scheme developed by the Office of Naval Records and Library. The diverse correspondence, reports, and other documents in this series of files cover a wide variety of topics involving general naval history, policy, strategy, personnel, the administration of forces, and equipment. These record are broken down into two parts for your research you will want to look into:

- Subject File of the U.S. Navy, 1775-1927 (RG 45, Entry 502) - https://catalog.archives.gov/id/594070 - A finding aid can be found on the catalog which allows researchers to search by subject.

Additionally, there is a records series: Area File of the Naval Records Collection, 1775-1910 (Entry 517). https://catalog.archives.gov/id/300258 These records can be found in Record Group 45: Naval Records Collection of the Office of Naval Records and Library and are arranged by geographical area, and thereunder chronologically. These records consist of letters, telegrams, radio messages and maps removed or copied from the Office of the Secretary of the Navy, Bureau of Navigation, Office of Naval Intelligence, and other Naval Departments. These records have been digitized and are available online. For information about these resources, please consult our webpage https://www.archives.gov/digitization/digitized-by-partners. Please note that researchers can access these online resources free of charge from any NARA facility.

Also, there is also a record series: Naval Attaché Reports, 1882–1945. (RG 38, Entry 98) https://catalog.archives.gov/id/1104923 These records can be found in Record Group 38: Records of the Office of the Chief of Naval Operations and are Arranged according to an agency created alpha-numeric classification scheme, and thereunder according to register number. (Finding Aid is available on our online catalog.)

You may also be interested in Record Group 59: General Records of the Department of State. For more information on records relating to the Department of State please contact our regional archives at the National Archives at College Park, MD. To speak with a representative please email their department at: Archives2reference@nara.gov.

Lastly, for papers related to Grover Cleveland we would recommend contacting the Library of Congress. For more information on his papers please visit their website at: https://www.loc.gov/collections/grover-cleveland-papers/about-this-collection/

We invite you to continue the conversation with community members on History Hub, but should you have follow-up questions for the staff at Archives 1 related to the records, please email us at archives1reference@nara.gov so that we can assist you further.

We hope this assists you with your research!
